content.label: Great game, I enjoyed it on Steam, but on my iPhone X the game is way too small and hard to play.
Finished the game. Wish I saved my money.

title.label: Awesome Port.  Now working on 8+ so 5 stars all the way!

content.label:
Great game,  Purchased day one when released on PC and played many hours there.  Once I saw an iOS release I jumped right on it.  This has been my go-to game during my morning commute on the train for months now.  The game played perfectly on my iPhone 5s, but I recently upgraded to the 8+ and for some reason it is stuck zoomed out incredibly far that it is almost impossible to play without straining your eyes.  Luckily I used the swipe style control scheme and that works just fine, but the HUD elements and everything else is just too small.  Hopefully this gets fixed soon, as this was one of the best games on iOS.  Would definitely rate 5 stars if the zoom issue on the 8+ gets fixed.    Also it would be nice to get the DLC added to the app store at some point, but even without this is a great game.

UPDATE 05/10/2018

Zoom issue is now fixed on the 8+. So now all I have to say is that this game is one of the best iOS ports I have played.  Definitely 5 stars.

The game itself is a 10/10, but that’s only on any different platform or system. If you try and download this game, it won’t even Install. It just freezes. It has happened to dozens of people. Don’t waste 5 dollars.

Update: hey devs I would really love to play the game that I paid for but you still haven’t fixed this for my iPhone X. The entire dpad is seriously half the size of my thumbprint, it is UNPLAYABLE!  I’m pretty annoyed now so my review is going to 1 Star.  I’ll change it once I can actually play the game , so fix it !

This games seriously needs an iPhone X update , it was great on my 6S+ but now the d-pads are way to small on my new X, it’s pretty much unplayable , which is a shame because the game is really great, please update soon and I’ll change my review.
The is UI way too small and completely unusable on newer devices such as the 7+, 8+, and X. If compatibility is added for a these devices, this game would definitely deserve 5 stars.

UPDATE: TOO SMALL AND IMPOSSIBLE TO CONTROL ON THE IPHONE X. 5-STAR GAME THAT IS UNPLAYABLE IN ITS CURRENT STATE.

Just a couple of ours into the Steam version on my computer and this title releases. I had been wondering whether the simple yet elaborate mechanics would be a good fit for mobile, and the developers have answered with a pulse-pounding affirmative. The rhythmic approach to traditional dungeon-crawling distinguishes this title from nearly all others. Thank you, Brace Yourself Games! I look forward to many hours of fun on the go. By the way, the addition of three separate control schemes and the option to play locally stored tunes speaks to the highest levels of developer prowess. These are the companies we should support. **EDIT: Actually I am and I do, "Glair ion." It just looks like I am enjoying it a whole lot more than you at this point. By the way, the devs wouldn't know me (or this review) from a hole in the wall. It's my honest opinion of the title.

I really love this game.  Difficult, original, and can be addictive.  It would be a five star game for me, except it obviously isn’t optimised for the X.  I can hardly make out the figure, and have looked for a zoom button but had no luck at all finding one.  If this were to be fixed it would easily be one of my all time favourites from the App Store.  Without being able to zoom the game is playable, but far less enjoyable.
Looks like garbage on Apple’s flagship phone.

It’s a great port of crypt of the NecroDancer but one big problem is that on my 8+ all the ui is very very small making it hard to play well. An option to scale the ui and zoom into the game would greatly improve the port

title.label: Love this game, perfect for mobile

content.label:
It only doesn’t get 5 stars because it currently doesn’t have support for iPhone X and that kinda makes edges hard to hit, and there are two features that would really help me play.

One is an option to change the d-pad size, on my iPhone X they are pretty tiny and hard to hit.

The other feature is keyboard control support. I would love to just be able to use my blue tooth keyboard for its physical buttons without having to have a MFi controller with me.

The game itself though, which I’ve played on pc and psvita, is great. It’s one of the only rogue likes that I can play. And I really enjoy the rhythm while dungeon crawling.

I have steam version too and I always play this game on PC.
JUST BECAUSE OF DLC.
Now, it’s essential for playing game.
Plz release DLC. Everyone is alright with it!

i love this game on mobile. beat it with my 6s in a day and got up to level 3 as melody. it’s fair to say i’m pretty decent at the game, the problem however is i recently got an iphone x. My backup for corrupted for my iphone 6s and had to download the game again (i didn’t select icloud save so i had to start all over- which i mean, that’s alright i wanted to do another play through anyway). however the game isn’t optimized for the iphone X. due to the added screen space on the X, the d pad controls are super small making it easy to “crush” the movement (like i literally dislike playing the first tutorial stage) and i can only imagine dying to tons of blood spells later in the game where combinations are needed. in conclusion/summary: please optimize this amazing port for the screen dimensions of the iphone x
Love the game but really can’t play it since getting the iPhone X. Is support coming soon?

title.label: I mean, It’s exactly the same...

content.label:
Still good, exactly like the PC Version. Definitely needs a resolution fix, or at least a hud button size setting, top priority is the resolution though, it promotes eye strain...

Otherwise it’s the exact same game (which is a wonderfully original game), so I still recommend it if you have any device that isn’t an 8+ or above.
I’ve tried restarting the iPhone and uninstalling the game and reinstalling. It will not download. On WiFi or on cellular data. And I can’t seem to find any help with the issue.

title.label: App took a while to Download

content.label: I purchased the app and after LOTS of rebooting (over 3 days) the game FINALLY downloaded

I was really hoping for a great game on my iPhone 8 Plus. Sadly the game seems to run in an eternal state of being zoomed out, causing the game to be way too small to see anything on the screen. What’s worse is this issue was brought up way back when the game first released and yet it still hasn’t been addressed in any way. It’s such a shame because the core game can be very fun.

title.label: Keep trying if you can't download

content.label:
A few phone reboots and many many tries and I have the software now. That never happens to me. It's a new phone... Idk
I got it now so thanks for the port work that went into this. Wishing you all success on your future projects.

The iPhone X has been out for nearly 3 months and this app still doesn’t support it. Why does apple feature apps that are not compatible with the latest hardware? Playing this game on iPhone X is so tiny and unusable. Please update your app

title.label: Great on an iPad Pro awful on an iPhone X

content.label: Way too small on an iPhone X. Works fine on an iPad Pro though.

This game is polished, unique, and almost bug free. There is a huge bug with the pause button — if you pause and come back sometimes the game will freeze, causing you to lose your progress, which is frustrating. Sometimes the game will lag for no reason— as if the character is underwater. 
Otherwise, the game is brutally difficult. It’s difficulty makes progress deliciously rewarding and there’s a somewhat consistent sense of progress, to keep you coming back. (That progress stops after a while though.) Regardless, the rush you feel after every run, success or fail, surpasses the frustration of the ridiculous learning curve. I do not recommend the game for anyone without a keen sense of rhythm; the rhythm is obviously a core part of the gameplay, and having not yet mastered keeping rhythm will make an already hardcore game a lot harder. You have been warned. However, if you have or are playing an instrument, like I am, then it’s a phenomenal game.
I paid $5 to download the game and it won’t even download. It just stalls, and never finishes installing.

I was very excited about this game and thought it would be amazing, so I bought it and.... it didn’t even download. I tried again after updating and restarting my phone and the app, but nothing changed. Very disappointed.
Well change rating if fixed
I have tried downloading it on my iPad and iPhone and it just failed and stalls on install..

It lacks the amplified dlc, while they updated with the danganronpa crossover, it still feels like it needs the amp dlc to feel whole, in my opinion. While I recommend it to peeps still on the fence about buying this on steam, I don’t recommend it to those who are finicky about control schemes

I love this game, it is my most played iOS game. The platform is perfect for mobile. Although there are some bugs that need to be sorted out. It doesn’t let me download from the app for most of the time. I also experience a crash half the time whenever the “low power” pop-up occurs:

title.label: Great on PC, great on iPad, with two caveats

content.label:
I love this game; I really do. It is super fun, original, and creative. However, there is one major oversight and one minor tweak that need to be fixed:

First, the major gripe: when using bluetooth headphones, there is no ability to compensate for bluetooth lag. We really need the ability to calibrate the audio, otherwise the game is quite un-fun. Since the iPhone 7 and 8 do not have headphone jacks, I only have bluetooth headphones now.

Second, the minor gripe: it would be really nice if you could enable keyboard controls for the iPad Pro hardware keyboard.

Keep it up, and keep it aweseome!

I’m not going to sugarcoat it: Crypt of the Necrodancer is hard. It is a game that requires tons of practice to learn every enemy attack, what every weapon/item does and how to use them to your advantage. Once you put in the time and learn it, you will find one of the most satisfying and fun games to play ever, though. There is no other game like Cotnd it offers a unique experience. Not to mention, the soundtrack is amazing. Its worth the purchase for that alone.

1 No Music sometimes when playing Bard
2 sometimes stuck on ice in Zone3. I cannot play anymore...

fun game

Whenever I play I'll be doing good then end up losing my multiplier because all the sudden the controls decided to be unresponsive. Not sure why this happens but it's annoying. Might just be me but idk

title.label: Dance to the best of the awesome music!

content.label:
This is a great game, doesn't get boring and the music always keeps you going :)
Highly recommend!!!
Fun game, but it crashes constantly. It would be 5 stars easy if you could fix the fact that whenever you get a phone call or have to minimize the game that it just resets the app completely.

title.label: Great game, excellent port, needs more control options.

content.label: Crypt of the NecroDancer is amazing and works well on mobile. However the devs need to add resizing options for buttons, since items are nearly unusable on swipe, and the d-pad configuration is too small for my fingers.

title.label: Better controls would make this 5 stars

content.label:
Crypt of the NecroDancer shines on mobile devices.

BUT however you configure the controls, frustration is looming.
Missed inputs, weird defined zones for the crosses. They are a source of endless frustration really.

If some effort could be made on the controls to be more player friendly and less punishing this would be 6 to 7 stars indeed.

I love necrodancer. I have 25 hours clocked in on my PC version. This game is really nice on mobile, however, it's plagued by crashes that can happen when my phone is locked or I tap on a notification that has popped up right where I was going to tap. Because I like to do all zone runs, this has become very difficult to deal with. If this were to be addressed, I would surely give this 5 stars. 
Device info:
IPhone 6s running iOS 10.3.2
This game seems to crash too much and it even reset my game
Played it on my laptop, loved it, decided I wanted it to play on my phone. Great game, just keeps crashing and resetting my progress out of nowhere.
Its perfect game for people who like challange And play with favorite music(original ost is awesome).

Great great great thanks to Danny!
His music makes the whole game shining!
It proves his ability and talent on composing multiple styles of music: from Zone 1's jumpy disco, to Zone 2's sleepy and creepy funk, to Zone 3's duet style(ice and fire) Rock, and to Zone 4 the dark dungeon maze-like feels with strings accompanying...

I am hoping the DLC Zone 5 will go on here soon, and absolutely love the new musics he made for that! Zone 5 themes bring electric on a whole new level!

Noticeable, Danny's music also attracted many other Composers and DJs to remix the tracks: big shout out to FamilyJules7x, one of the best guitar players I heard!
The game is great, but it's pretty frustrating when I lose because I want to go in one direction and end up in another because the controls are too small.
This has become my new favorite game, it is an excellent roguelike and well worth the price. Even if you don't like the rhythm aspect you can just play as the bard.

Really fun game. Unforgiving, but that means you see the improvement in your play over time. Devs, pretty please fix it so my save data doesn't disappear on updating, and also the game quits often when I die and start immediately pressing where "quick restart" will be. Playing on iPhone SE running os 9.3.4
I bought this game for my pc a while back and loved it. This mobile version is great! Lots of fun takes some getting used to but it is well worth it!

This game is really awesome. You will get hooked after the first beat. This game would be worth 5 stars, but there is a bug that can ruin your experience. I played this game non-stop for about two weeks. But then suddenly my save data was completely erased, except for my run replays. I played it again from the beginning, and the bug happened again. Now, I'm in an infinite loop of playing and being forced to start over. Don't let that discourage you. This game is worth all of its praise and its $5 price tag.
It keeps deleting my save data, and the controls aren't sizable.

Awesome game. Played it tons on Steam. Played this lots on my phone. Awesome music. Fun items. I do agree the controls should be adjustable but it is not unplayable or anything. I love this game and you should buy it. I can't wait for my vinyl to arrive!

Edit 3: I cannot express my disappointment in this app and its developers. Please, just contact the guys who made Siralim. You're running the same engine and they have the option to modify button size. 
Ps: downgrader, my apologies. My beef clearly isn't with you. Live long and prosper!

Edit 2: still no update on controls... wow. Lowering from 2 to 1 stars now. This company needs to get the biggest priority straight on this game: better controls! And clearly they pay their reviewers. This review from "downgrader" for instance has reappeared after every one of these unnecessary updates--like, the day after. There is no humanly way anybody is enjoying this port enough to update his review every time after a useless update, at least not in the state of its current controls. Tacky, brace yourself, reeeeeal tacky.

Edit: I was reeeealy hoping they would add size adjustments for the d pad controls with this recent update, since reviewers other than myself had also commented upon it. They did not do this relatively simple--and wildly important--fix. 2 stars. 

This game is a whole lot of fun, with swank music and charming graphics. But unfortunately, the controls are very unkind on an iPad. The only setting I can reliably use is the d pad option, but the two d pads are not well sized in my experience. If one is paying attention to the action, it's hard to see whether ones fingers are perfectly aligned with the small d pad buttons.

I've played other games that have allowed the player to modify the size of those d pad buttons and I really hope the devs include that in an update.

What really makes this game good is that you can use your own music library. The default soundtrack is fantastic already but adding undertale and hotline miami soundtrack to the beat of this game is even better! 10/10 👌
